answers.answer: Hi,Urinary tract infections secondary to viruses are rare. Examples of viruses are HIV, polyoma virus ,BK-JCV viruses. Usually immunocompromised patients do get these type of infections. Signs and symptoms of urinary pattern changes such as frequency and urgency may also be present .But with underlying systemic problems like diabetes and other systemic infections then they may manifest atypical presentations.Here is a url of BK virus infections. One of the polyoma viruses implicated in renal infections especially among renal transplant patients:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BK_virus
